involvements.title: Founder
description: ● Proposed idea and detailed plan to Department Chair and received approval and funding for Fall 2017.
● Purpose is to mentor incoming student within the CS department, and give them the necessary resources and awareness about opportunities to excel
● Hold monthly meeting with 13 mentors and 27 mentees covering various topics including 'How to be involved in the VCU CS department' and 'Career Paths for a CS Student
involvements.imageCaption: A selfie of my mentee and me after our first monthly meetup dinner!

involvements.title: Co-Founder
description: ● Organization to promote and support Women in Tech
● Starting a industry to student mentoring program
● Host workshops to encourage women to stay and thrive in Tech
involvements.imageCaption: A workshop on ReactJS by Rachel Dorn, a CoStar Group employee

description: ● Advisor to the Chair of VCU's Computer Science Department
● Attend CS faculty interviews and give input to the Department Chair
● Involved in encouraging student engagement and community outreach through CS organizations, Engineering Open Houses, and high school programming contests
involvements.imageCaption: The Fall 2017 Student Advisory Board members posing along with me!

involvements.title: Head Organizer
description: ● Hosted a 24 hour hackathon with over 230 participants and 17 sponsoring companies
● Responsible for sponsor contact, and maintenance of challenge, judging, and mentoring information.
● Attended Major League Hacking HackCon 2017 conference
involvements.imageCaption: Quark, a fellow organizer, and I participating in MLH's cup stacking event along with other participants. We ended up with a 21 cups high stack!

involvements.title: Vice President
description: ● Lead tours within the Engineering School

involvements.organization: Theta Tau: A Professional Engineering Fraternity
involvements.title: Treasurer
description: ● As Treasurer, responsible for creating a semesterly budget for over $10,000. On a daily basis, I maintain the budget, handle reallocations, collect semester dues, and handle reimbursements.

● As a member of the Professional Development committee and Engineering Student Relations committee, I have organized multiple workshops, co-organized a sustainability hackathon, and increased involvement between engineering students and the engineering school through a departmental feedback panel.
involvements.imageCaption: My Little, Divya, and me showing our spirit for a Big-Little Olympics match!
